alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 9:49AM CDT until June 08 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas... Southwestern Madison County in northwestern Arkansas... Southern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... Franklin County in west central Arkansas... Southeastern Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 245 PM CDT. * At 949 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stilwell... Ozark... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Prairie Grove... West Fork... Lincoln... Mulberry... Westville... Altus... Winslow... Denning... Chester... St. Paul... Wiederkehr Village... Devils Den State Park... Blackburn... Lake Fort Smith... Brentwood... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
